main event: On May 22, 1949, a civilian reported an unidentified aerial object over Caddo Lake, one mile west of Morningsport, Louisiana. The object appeared to be silver in color, oblong, and flew in a straight line at an extremely high altitude before fading from view due to distance.
interesting points: The sighting lasted between 4 to 10 minutes, with the object estimated to be 8 to 10 thousand feet in altitude, about 4 feet in thickness, and the size of a B-29.
The object was observed flying at a speed of 500 miles per hour in a continued straight flight with no associated sound.

The reporting officer, approx 15 miles from Caddo Lake, positively identified an aircraft as a B-36 at an altitude of 30,000 feet around the same time, suggesting the reported object might have been a similar aircraft.
The civilian felt compelled to report the incident after reading about a 'Flying Saucer' sighting in Shreveport, Louisiana, on May 24, 1949.
The reliability of the observers was checked and deemed favorable by the investigating officer.
result: Possible aircraft, as per the opinion of the reporting officer, due to doubts about the ability to accurately estimate altitude.
witnesses: Civilian, his wife, his son, and others on a fishing party
